incidents.name: Toll-Free Verification Returning 500s Errors

incident_updates.body: Toll-free verification was degraded for 7 minutes between 6:59 am and 07:06 Pacific Time on 09/29/2023. During this period of time customers may have experienced 500s errors. The issue has now been resolved.

Our engineers are currently investigating the customer impact of a retroactive issue with toll-free verification returning 500s. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: SMS Failures to India Airtel Numbers

incident_updates.body: SMS to India Airtel service was degraded for 3 days aprox. We estimate that the impacted initially started on 09/25/2023 and ended by 09/28/2023 at 2:00 AM Pacific Time. During this period of time, customers may have not been able to send SMS messages to a subset of Airtel India numbers. The issue has now been resolved.

Our engineers are currently investigating the customer impact of a retroactive issue with receiving API rejections with error code 21614 for messaging API when trying to send SMS messages to Indian Airtel numbers. This incident has been resolved. We will follow up and provide customer impact details within 2 hours.

incidents.name: Service Disruption in Twilio API-s in the IE1 Region, in Ireland

incident_updates.body: We're making a correction to the existing post https://status.twilio.com/incidents/cjpncc0g8k15. Twilio Programable Chat and Conversations public APIs in IE1 region, in Ireland were degraded for 5 minutes between 9:56 and 10:00 Pacific Time on 09/28/2023. During this period of time customers may have experienced 500s errors. The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: Service Disruption in all Twilio API-s (Conversations API, Programmable Chat, Voice) in the IE1 Region

incident_updates.body:
Twilio Programable Chat and Conversations public APIs in all Twilio API-s (Conversations API, Programmable Chat, Voice) were degraded for 5 minutes between 9:56 and 10:00 Pacific Time on 09/28/2023. During this period of time customers may have experienced 500s errors. The issue has now been resolved.

*We're making a correction to this post, please check impact details at https://status.twilio.com/incidents/dglrb2zhzq1w

Our engineers are currently investigating the customer impact of a retroactive issue with Conversations and Programmable Chat API. We will follow up and provide customer impact details within 2 hours.

incidents.name: Voice Suspension Banner in the Console in Active Accounts

incident_updates.body: This Console incident has been resolved and service is operating normally at this time.

The incident causing Voice Account Suspension banner in the Console is now resolved. We will continue to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have identified the issue in the Console and are actively working to deploy a fix. Customers may see the banner: ‘’Voice has been suspended. Your account has been suspended from making and receiving voice call due to potentially fraudulent activity’’.  Accounts remain active and operating. We expect to provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available

We are investigating an issue with the console. Customer are seeing a Voice Suspension Banner, but accounts remain active and operating. We expect to provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available
Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue in the Console. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Possible Connectivity Issue on Super SIM

incident_updates.body: The connectivity issues on Super SIM has been resolved and Super Sim is operating normally at this time.
Super SIM is now operating normally. We are continuing to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.
Super SIM is now operating normally. We will continue to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

We have identified some unusual patterns in traffic from our carrier partner that is preferred in a number of countries around the world, including the United States, that could indicate some devices are having trouble connecting. We have been unable to reproduce any connection issues via our own tests and we have thus far received limits reports of issues. As such, we have opted to not block any carrier partner and network combinations as this could result to wide spread connectivity issues for other customers not impacted around the world. However, if you are currently severely impacted by connectivity issues, you can request our support team block connections on the impacted connectivity partner to see if switching to other IMSIs can improve your connectivity.

In the United States, it appears that the issue may be more likely on T-Mobile; however, that the more noticeable decline in connections on T-Mobile may be coincidental as we are still investigating the matter with our carrier partner.If you have a Network Access Profile with only T-Mobile enabled, your devices may be able to reconnect after enabling AT&T and/or Verizon. For connectivity issues in the US, we suggest first adjusting networks allowed by your Network Access Profile before we block carrier partners to force your SIMs to fallback to other IMSIs on your Super SIMs.

We have identified some unusual patterns in traffic from our carrier partner that is preferred in a number of countries around the world, including the United States, that could indicate some devices are having trouble connecting. We have been unable to reproduce any connection issues via our own tests and we have thus far received limits reports of issues. As such, we have opted to not block any carrier partner and network combinations as this could result to wide spread connectivity issues for other customers not impacted around the world. However, if you are currently severely impacted by connectivity issues, you can request our support team block connections on the impacted connectivity partner to see if switching to other IMSIs can improve your connectivity.

In the United States, it appears that the issue may be more likely on T-Mobile; however, that the more noticeable decline in connections on T-Mobile may be coincidental as we are still investigating the matter with our carrier partner.If you have a Network Access Profile with only T-Mobile enabled, your devices may be able to reconnect after enabling AT&T and/or Verizon. For connectivity issues in the US, we suggest first adjusting networks allowed by your Network Access Profile before we block carrier partners to force your SIMs to fallback to other IMSIs on your Super SIMs.

Our engineering team is investigating reports of connectivity issues on Super SIM. If you are experiencing a disruption to connectivity, please contact customer support with impacted ICCIDs and countries. We will provide an update within 4 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.
